content.user_title: Build modern web apps with React and Next.js
content.value_statement: Frontend development requires managing component architecture, performance optimization, and code organization at scale. This skill provides automated tooling and best practices for building production-ready React applications with TypeScript, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS.
actual_capabilities: Generate React and TypeScript components with proper structure, imports, and prop typing
Analyze frontend bundle size and identify optimization opportunities for code splitting
Scaffold new frontend projects with modern stack configuration including Next.js and Tailwind
Apply React patterns including hooks, compound components, and state management best practices
Optimize Next.js applications for performance, caching, and SEO improvements
Review frontend code for anti-patterns, accessibility issues, and code quality
limitations: Does not execute npm install or build commands directly on user systems
Does not access user environment variables or secrets
Does not modify production code without explicit user approval
Does not deploy applications to cloud platforms

use_cases.title: Scaffold React components
use_cases.description: Generate new React components with TypeScript, proper props, and styling following best practices

use_cases.title: Optimize bundle size
use_cases.description: Analyze frontend bundles and identify large dependencies for tree-shaking optimization

use_cases.title: Enforce coding standards
use_cases.description: Generate consistent component patterns across team codebase with documentation

prompt_templates.title: Create Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new React component called Button in TypeScript. Include proper TypeScript interfaces for props, handle loading and error states, and use Tailwind CSS for styling variants.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze Bundle
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the bundle size of my Next.js application. Identify the largest dependencies and suggest optimizations for code splitting to reduce initial load time.

prompt_templates.title: Setup Project
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a new Next.js project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and proper folder structure following modern React patterns and best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor Code
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my React component and refactor it to use proper hooks, memoization, and separate business logic from presentation for better performance.

output_examples.input: Create a Button component with variants
output: Generates Button.tsx with TypeScript interfaces for props
Uses Tailwind CSS classes for primary, secondary, danger variants
Includes loading and error state handling
Reports bundle size by chunk with visual breakdown
Suggests dynamic imports for heavy components
Provides estimated savings for each optimization
Creates Next.js + TypeScript + Tailwind project structure
Generates components folder with atomic organization
Sets up Jest and React Testing Library

best_practices: Use TypeScript interfaces for all component props to ensure type safety across the application
Separate business logic from presentation using custom hooks for reusable state management
Optimize bundle size by lazy loading routes and using dynamic imports for heavy components
anti_patterns: Avoid prop drilling through multiple component layers; use context or state management instead
Do not put all state in useState; prefer useReducer for complex state logic
Avoid inline function definitions in JSX render to prevent unnecessary re-renders

faq.question: What React versions are supported?
faq.answer: Supports React 18 and newer with hooks-based patterns. Works with Next.js 13+ App Router and Pages Router.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: It generates new files and suggests improvements. All code modifications require explicit user approval before execution.

faq.question: Can I customize component templates?
faq.answer: Yes, templates are configurable through script options. Custom templates can be added to the references directory.

faq.question: What styling approaches are supported?
faq.answer: Tailwind CSS is primary. Can generate CSS Modules, styled-components, or plain CSS on request.

faq.question: Does this work with React Native?
faq.answer: Core React patterns apply. Use the component generator with React Native project structure for mobile development.

faq.question: How does bundle analysis work?
faq.answer: Scans build output to report chunk sizes, identifies large dependencies, and suggests tree-shaking and code splitting strategies.
